alert.note: Alert for Anoka; Chisago; Hennepin; Ramsey; Washington (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 3:31PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Hennepin, southeastern Chisago, Anoka, Washington, Ramsey, northwestern St. Croix and southwestern Polk Counties through 415 PM CDT... At 331 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Spring Lake Park, or 10 miles north of Minneapolis, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Shoreview, Mounds View and Arden Hills around 335 PM CDT. Blaine, Lino Lakes and Vadnais Heights around 340 PM CDT. Hugo around 345 PM CDT. Forest Lake around 350 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Chisago City, Scandia, Lindstrom, Osceola, Center City, St. Croix Falls, Taylors Falls and Dresser. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 130 and 145. U.S. Highway 8 in Minnesota between mile markers 0 and 5, and between mile markers 7 and 22. U.S. Highway 61 between mile markers 163 and 164. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for central and east central Minnesota...and northwestern and west central Wisconsin.
